This might clear a few misconceptions up. =C2=A0 It is a very broad spectru=
m and includes radio waves.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electromagnetic_s=
pectrum
=C2=A0"Nature is showing us only the tail of the lion, but I have n=
o doubt that the lion belongs to it even though, because of its large size,=
 it cannot totally reveal itself all at once." 
-=E2=80=94 Albert Einstein =



"It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persist =
in delusions, however satisfying and reassuring."
--Carl Sagan


"There is =
no such thing as an insignificant detail. Don't just look 
for what you wan=
t to find."
-- Me LOL

From: April Abe=
rcrombie <april@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
S=
ent: Monday, June 8, 2009 3:21:23 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas





=
This seems to jive with what I have learned this far, but I am still not ce=
rtain I understand it completely.
=C2=A0
I thought everything was based in =
the electromagnetic spectrum.

----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ra=
tka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 2:05 PM
Subj=
ect: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas

Tell me where the seperation on the spectrum =
takes place between 300Hz and 300KHz. Yes, soundwaves cause pressure waves =
that our ears read as vibration and our mind translates as sound. The waves=
 are still on the electromagnetic spectrum. Even subsonic geomagnetic waves=
 are present on the scale. What I mean by power can be directll translated =
to volume or amplitude. The only thing that distinguishes soundwaves from a=
ny other wave is the fact that we can hear them.

Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8=
/09, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:


From: Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com>
Subje=
ct: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June=
 8, 2009, 2:53 PM


No. Sounds waves are not on the electromagnet spectrum =
nor are they a form of electromagnet energy. Sound waves are based on press=
ure waves in the air (or in other substances).=C2=A0 Our ears detect these =
pressure waves and translate them into sounds we here.=C2=A0 Our ear do NOT=
 hear electromagnet energy.=C2=A0 Our eyes do: that part which we call visi=
ble light.



--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com> wro=
te:


From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@ yahoo.com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ne=
w ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 12:38 PM

=

It sounds like she's saying "one, two, ....."

A mistake that a lot of peo=
ple make is thinking that there are two different types of energy at work w=
hen it comes to sound waves and electromagnetic waves. The only thing that =
seperates them is frequency and power. Radio waves are radio waves because =
they occupy a certain block of the electromagnietic spectrum. Sound waves e=
xist on that same spectrum just farther down with much longer waves. Soundw=
aves and subsonic waves can penetrate almost anything because of their wave=
lengths. The shorter the wavelength the more ways we can shield against the=
m.

Think of microwaves. These are also a type of radio and telemetry trans=
mitting wave but the waves also have a physical effect on our environment b=
y causing molecules to speed up, which creates heat. A little lower than th=
is is IR or infrared it too can cause physical objects to heat up but usual=
ly it just causes molecules to rotate in place. All physical things give of=
f IR light. Its a way the total system conserves energy by spontaneously em=
itting IR radiation.

Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, April Abercrombie <apri=
l@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:


From: April Abercrombie <april@a=
bercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas [3 Attachme=
nts]
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 2:27 PM


Her=
e is some food for thought. I am currently reviewing my audio from our May =
30th investigation.
=C2=A0
It was me and another girl teammate=C2=A0present=
 in the room. I picked up a 3rd female voice on my digital voice recorder t=
hat I carry with me. We were standing right next to another digital video r=
ecorder that I leave beside my night vision camera. That recorder did not p=
ick up this 3rd voice. I have asked the girl that was with me to check her =
recording to see if she picked it up.
=C2=A0
I have long felt the true EVP =
does not come from sound waves in the environment, or then it wouldn't be E=
VP, but a disembodied voice. Somehow EVP's are appearing directly on the re=
cordings.
=C2=A0
This instance with the recorders may back that theory up. =
That other recorder should have picked that voice up if it were sound waves=
 in the environment.
=C2=A0
I am attaching the clip of this 3rd voice. The=
=C2=A0file that is named=C2=A0"01-02-17 Clip" is the full clip.=C2=A0You wi=
ll hear my voice as I say "Yeah", and then another comes in right after tha=
t. I think I know what it says.
=C2=A0
Again, I was live monitoring my audi=
o, but still did not hear this until playback. It isn't clear, so I am not =
as excited about it as my one's from the last investigation.
=C2=A0
=C2=A0
=
----- Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Ratka 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .c=
om 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2009 1:09 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas

I=
 have a running theory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodu=
lated exactly where they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne p=
rinciple. If you mix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in freque=
ncy then if you add or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or a=
lternate frequency. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz an=
d you have an electric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45=
KHz then you will have a intermediate difference=C2=A0frequency at 9KHz, we=
ll within human hearing range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, bu=
t all electronic equipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning the=
m on. From this theory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few i=
nches of the recorder.

We are able to reproduce this affect in not only ra=
dio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audio as in so=
me passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spotlight" by =
Dr. Joseph Pompeii.

Frank R.

--- On Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gm=
ail. com> wrote:


From: Zack Widup <w9sz.zack@gmail. com>
Subject: Re: [EV=
P-ITC] New ideas
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Monday, June 8, 2009, 1=
:56 PM


Fascinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often=C2=A0not re=
corded by the microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual=C2=A0p=
oint where the storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital.=C2=
=A0

So much we don't know ...

Zack

=C2=A0
On Mon, Jun 8, 2009 at 1:39 PM=
, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com> wrote:




I mon=
itor my audio live. The funny thing is that even so, those last EVP's I cap=
tured I did not hear either in the environment, or on my recording as it ha=
ppened. I only heard them upon playback.
=C2=A0
----- Original Message ----=
- 
From: Zack Widup 
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
Sent: Monday, June 08, 2=
009 11:40 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] New ideas

I am curious if anyone with =
a microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.

=
I=C2=A0took part in=C2=A0an investigation of Ashmore Estates, near Ashmore =
IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras set up in the three halls o=
f the building. The video for all=C2=A0was being monitored and recorded=C2=
=A0at a central location. Alas, we did not have microphones at the camera s=
ites conected to the central location. I wonder what we might have heard if=
 we did?

Zack

=C2=A0

.com <Threadsintyme@ juno.com> wrote:

sion about her... 
Why don't we discuss something on a lighter note? Anyone=
 have any new ideas about either evp or ITC? 
Al

<TABLE cellSpacing=3D0 cellPadd=
ing=3D0 border=3D0>
<TBODY>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=3Dtop>
<DIV>I have a running th=
eory that EVP is carried on an untrasonic wave and demodulated exactly wher=
e they want it to manifest. It works off the heterodyne principle. If you m=
ix two ultrasonic waves that differ one another in frequency then if you ad=
d or subtract them together you get a beat frequency or alternate frequency=
. For example, if a ghost is sending a signal at 54KHz and you have an elec=
tric fan in a room creating an untrasonic frequency at 45KHz then you will =
have a intermediate difference frequency at 9KHz, well within human he=
aring range (20Hz to 20KHz). This was just an example, but all electronic e=
quipment generates ultrasonic signals just by turning them on. From this th=
eory I always felt that EVP were generated within a few inches of the recor=
der.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>We are able to reproduce this affect in n=
ot only radio with superheterodyne systems but also with acoustics and audi=
o as in some passive sonars and a commercial produce called the "audio spot=
light" by Dr. Joseph Pompeii.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Frank R.<BR><BR>=
--- On <B>Mon, 6/8/09, Zack Widup <I><w9sz.zack@gmail. com></I></B> w=

1:56 PM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=3Dyiv100209972>
<DIV id=3Dygrp-text>
<DIV>
<DIV>Fas=
cinating! I've had this idea that the EVP are often not recorded by th=
e microphone but somehow make their way in at the actual point where t=
he storage is made, whether it be analog (tape) or digital. <BR></DIV>=

<DIV>So much we don't know ...</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Zack</DIV>

<DIV>I am curious if anyone with a=
 microphone wired to a remote site has ever gotten any EVP in real time.</D=

<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>I took part in an investigation of Ash=
more Estates, near Ashmore IL, on Saturday night. We had six video cameras =
set up in the three halls of the building. The video for all was being=
 monitored and recorded at a central location. Alas, we did not have m=
icrophones at the camera sites conected to the central location. I wonder w=
hat we might have heard if we did?</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
